page.title: 14BRACKENBURGH HOME FARM
page.content: Reference should be made to our photograph of this farm. The structure is an interesting example of the way in which farming has developed in this area over the last few generations. Originally, the farmstead was constructed to cater primarily for dairy production, which was conducted on a fairly extensive scale, as the buildings indicate. Today, they all stand empty of cattle of any kind, despite their excellent design, as it is preferable for this farm to have gone over exclusively to grain and cereal crop production. The buildings are used today for storage and sacking of grain, and to house machinery and equipment.
